result.execSummary:
The defendant William H. Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling; Good Faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Absolute Sobriety.

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: 6 Months Stayed for rule violations w/Huber for work, school, treatment, child care; No objection to EMP

superMiscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTE/schooling or a combination
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended.  AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample. 

Court costs as previously assessed.

Case called: 9:36 am
INCLUDES 17CF842, 17CF785, 16CM837, 14CF612.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Genelle Johnson;
PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 17CF842:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA HEARING IN 17CF842, 17CF785, 16CM837:
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
17CF842:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Repeater)>>DRI.

17CF785:
Ct. 1 (BJ by Witness-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Fraud on Gas Station-Repeater)>>DRI.

16CM837:
Ct. 1- Delete 'Repeater' Enhancer.
Ct. 2 (Operating w/ PAC (2nd))-Repeater))>>DISMISS OUTRIGHT.
Ct. 3 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)-Repeater))>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE. 

PLEA: 
17CF842:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 3 (Possession of THC-Repeater)>> GUILTY.

16CM837:
Ct. 1 (OWI (2nd))>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
17CF842:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent to Ct. 3 and Consecutive to 16CM837 & 14CF612. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Restitution in the amount of $20 to be paid to the R-Store from case number 17CF785, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. 

Ct. 3 (Possession of THC-Repeater)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation, Concurrent to Ct. 1 and Consecutive to 16CM837 & 14CF612. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. 

16CM837:
Ct. 1 (OWI (2nd))>> 60 Days MCJ. $1760 fine inclusive, DNA Sample. Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 14 Months, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed immediately; IID installation fee to be paid; 14 Months dl revocation; AODA. Court finds 4 Days Credit. 

SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION ON 14CF612:
14CF612:
Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics-Repeater)>> 3 Years WSPS, 18 Months IC and 18 Months ES. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. COURT FINDS 551 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for CIP and SAP. 

Adjourned: 9:53 am

MINUTES AMENDED 2/14/2018 @ 1:15 PM
